function initializePlots() {
    let layout = {
        title: 'Click an Offense to View Locations',
        margin: {l: 300, r: 50, t: 50, b: 50}, // Adjust margins to ensure full visibility
        paper_bgcolor: '#f1f1f1', // A soft gray background that complements the vibrant and deep colors
        plot_bgcolor: '#fafafa', // A slightly lighter shade for the plotting area to add depth
        font: {
            family: 'Helvetica Neue, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif',
            size: 14,
            color: '#333333'
        },
        xaxis: {
            tickfont: {
                size: 12
            }
        },
        yaxis: {
            tickfont: {
                size: 14
            }
        }
    };

    Plotly.newPlot('plot1', [{
        y: [],
        x: [],
        type: 'bar',
        orientation: 'h',
        marker: {
            color: '#E63946', // Vibrant red for the first plot
            line: {
                color: '#C53034', // A slightly darker red for border
                width: 1.5
            }
        },
        name: 'Total Offenses'
    }], layout);

    layout.title = 'Details for Selected Offense';
    Plotly.newPlot('plot2', [{
        y: [],
        x: [],
        type: 'bar',
        orientation: 'h',
        marker: {
            color: '#1D3557', // Deep navy blue for the second plot
            line: {
                color: '#162A40', // An even deeper blue for border
                width: 1.5
            }
        },
        name: 'Offense Locations'
    }], layout);
}

function processDataAndPlot(dataFromPython) {
    let offenseData = dataFromPython.reduce((acc, curr) => {
        let offense = acc[curr.OFFENSE_NAME] || {total: 0, details: []};
        offense.total += curr.OFFENSE_COUNT;
        offense.details.push({location: curr.LOCATION_NAME, count: curr.OFFENSE_COUNT});
        acc[curr.OFFENSE_NAME] = offense;
        return acc;
    }, {});

    let sortedOffenses = Object.entries(offenseData)
        .sort((a, b) => b[1].total - a[1].total)
        .slice(0, 10)  // Take only the top 10 offenses
        .map(item => item[0]);

    let sortedCounts = Object.entries(offenseData)
        .sort((a, b) => b[1].total - a[1].total)
        .slice(0, 10)  // Corresponding counts for the top 10
        .map(item => item[1].total);

    Plotly.restyle('plot1', {y: [sortedOffenses.reverse()], x: [sortedCounts.reverse()]});
    Plotly.restyle('plot2', {y: [[]], x: [[]]}); // Clear plot2 when switching datasets

    document.getElementById('plot1').on('plotly_click', function(data) {
        if (data.points.length > 0) {
            const selectedOffense = data.points[0].y;
            let details = offenseData[selectedOffense].details;

            if (details) {
                details.sort((a, b) => b.count - a.count);

                let locations = details.slice(0, 10).map(item => item.location); // Top 10 locations for the selected offense
                let locationCounts = details.slice(0, 10).map(item => item.count);

                Plotly.restyle('plot2', {y: [locations.reverse()], x: [locationCounts.reverse()]});
                Plotly.relayout('plot2', {
                    title: `Locations for Offense: ${selectedOffense}` // Update title dynamically
                });
            }
        }
    });
}


function attachButtonHandlers() {
    document.getElementById('dataset2018Button').addEventListener('click', () => {
        processDataAndPlot(data2018);
    });
    document.getElementById('dataset2020Button').addEventListener('click', () => {
        processDataAndPlot(data2020);
    });
    document.getElementById('dataset2022Button').addEventListener('click', () => {
        processDataAndPlot(data2022);
    });
}
</script>
